snippet: The attack, in which two bombers detonated suicide vests as soldiers were patrolling near the provincial council’s office, occurred just a few days after the Taliban made a show of force in Kunar Province.
abstract: Three NATO soldiers and an Afghan civilian are killed in a suicide attack in the middle of the provincial capital of Kunar Province in eastern Afghanistan; attack, in which two bombers detonated suicide vests as soldiers were patrolling near the provincial council’s office, occurs just a few days after the Taliban made a show of force in Kunar, a rugged border province that has been one of the most hard-fought regions for the American military.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Kunar Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The attack, in which two bombers detonated suicide vests as soldiers were patrolling near the provincial council’s office, occurred just a few days after the Taliban made a show of force in Kunar Province.

headline.seo: Kunar Province Suicide Bombings Kill 4 in Afghanistan
headline.main: Fatal Attack Shows Plan to Unsettle Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Fatal Attack Shows Plan To Unsettle Afghanistan
